All Reviews

  1. My legs have never been so smooth and cutless! I loved this razor. Definitely will continue purchasing. Even my husband uses it! My overall experience has been great. Thanks to a program run buy via venus & olay!
  2. After receiving a free razor from a program with Gillette, I was excited to try out this product. As a long-time Venus user, I prefer using the razor+shaving cream instead of just the razor with the Olay bars (I feel like I get a slightly closer shave when I use shaving cream). In my opinion, I feel like the bars will run out before the razor is completely useless, and therefore will not use it for everyday use. But, I feel like this product is perfect for vacations and travelling when one might not necessarily have the room to pack a razor+shaving cream, or simply does not want to. Although I'm not a fan of this product for daily use, I think it has a fantastic smell--very fruity--although, I would not recommend this scent to somebody like my grandmother because the smell would be too fruity for her. I also love the bright pink handle, and will be placing my regular Venus blade heads on it after the razor is no longer of any use.
  3. I love this razor so much! Gillete Venus & Olay sugarberry razor is the best razor I have tried. I actually got this from a program run by this company- for free! Anyways, it smells like a tangy green apple: A scent I love so much! See, this razor helps to avoid nicks. The head swirls and is movable, and the handle has a comfy gel grip. Cute, I might add. However, this razor is a bit slimy(Creepy!) when wet, but you can rinse the slime off. The moisture bars are my new lotion. No more lotion, no more shaving cream! And best of all- a ridiculously close shave with the five blades. Thank you, razor of mine! Now I actually want to show off my smooth legs!
  4. usually I am hesitant to use a razor with a soap bar it usually leaves me with razor burn/rash.. I tried this razor not only did it smell good but it left my legs with a nice silky smooth feeling.. I also used this to shave my arms and they feeling amazing.. the only thing I dislike about the product is how fast you go through the bar. but definitely worth trying!! :)
  5. I don't normally use disposable razors, but I received this one free as a promotion from Gillette Venus. I was a little skeptical at first but gave this razor a try.<br /><br />The Good:<br />- The sugarberry scent smelled really nice.<br />- The Olay bar surrounding the razor and the five blades left my legs silky and smooth.<br />- This product is decently priced for a disposable.<br /><br />The Bad:<br />- The Olay bar surrounding the razor got pretty sticky<br />- I didn't like how big the Olay bar was, it made it hard to get into tighter areas (ex: behind the knees). I had to go back over those areas with my normal razor to get the hairs that this razor missed.<br />- I got nicked several times trying to shave behind my knees.<br />- I also didn't like the holder that the razor came with. I have a tiled shower and it still wouldn't stick to it for longer than a couple of hours.<br /><br />Overview:<br /><br />If you normally like disposables that have large bars surrounding the razor then this is for you.<br />If you like razors that are more compact and of higher quality then I wouldn't recommend this for you.
  6. This razor smells amazing! It is definitely my favorite out of all the Venus razors. It gave me a very close shave and made my skin feel silky smooth. The best part is you can use this razor without having to use shaving cream! I tried this for free via a program run by Gillette Venus!
  7. Overall I had a great experience with this razor. I was a little put off by the sparkly packaging - it seems kind of juvenile. However, the product more than made up for it. It isn't too overpowering but it is definitely there for those close enough to appreciate it ;)<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this razor and I will be buying refills!

I still prefer the Venus razor without a bar soap attached because this kind is too wide for those small areas.<br /><br />Overall, I will keep using this product for my legs but stick to regular razors for my ankles, knees, and underarms.
  13. Love that I can skip the shaving cream step and makes shaving much more simpler! It's a great product and the olay bar is very smooth.
  14. When I received the razor in the mail through a program ran by Gillette Venus I was not expecting to receive a razor of such great quality. When I went to shave my legs I reached for the shaving cream and then realized that a shaving prep wasn't needed when using this razor because of the moisture bars, how convenient! While shaving I was amazed by how smooth and silky of a shave this razor provided. Prior to this experience, I have been using the same type of razor and razor blades for years (which are also more expensive than the Gillette Venus & Olay razor) but I think it's safe to say I'll be moving on from my old ways and will continue to use this fantastic razor. As for the downfalls, I haven't had to replace the cartridge yet and I feel like since the Olay Sugarberry moisture bar is a part of this razor it may result in going through razor blades faster than normal, being that the moisture bar will deplete faster than the quality and sharpness of the razor. Also, I did notice that the moisture bar did clump up and form a residue while shaving resulting in a clogged razor. Other than those few minor setbacks, I love this razor and will continue to use it!
  15. I received this razor in a promotional program run by Gillette.<br />I was pretty pleased with quality of this razor, as I have always been with Gillette products.<br />As far as the blades themselves they provide a good shave, that leaves your skin very smooth. The Olay bars also help with the \\"smooth\\" factor. The only downside is that the Olay bars are completely gone long before I feel like the blades are dull enough to justify changing my razor head.<br />I was skeptical after hearing mixed reviews on the scent, and I'm fairly neutral on that part of it. I don't notice the scent after I leave the shower, and even in the shower I don't find it to be repulsive. However I wouldn't go out of my way for it either.<br /><br />Great razor, while the Olay bars last.

  19. This next product was provided via a program run by Gillette Venus. Most of my products are actually purchased by myself but I could not resist something that is free. I have had Venus razors in the past and couldn't wait to review this one. This razor is just like the Schick Intuition (which I tried in the past and hated!) I shave with soap usually because it is cheaper than cream and even if my razor is dull, I rarely nick my legs.<br /><br />This product has two moisture bars around the 5 bladed shaver and comes with a cute shower holder so that the razor can hang to dry. The package claims, \\"exfoliates for surface skin renewal and helps replenish skin's moisture\\". This product is also scented, which is pretty nifty because there are not many out there like this. The instructions said to wet the razor for a light lather.<br /><br />As I started to shave my legs, I instantly noticed that this would only work for my legs and not areas such as the bikini line or arm pit because of the bulkiness of the bars. The next thing I noticed is that the scent was not too overpowering. I know that when products have scents, there is always a group of people that hate it. I found the smell pleasant and after the shower, it did not cling to my legs.<br /><br />I would just like to put out there that I am Italian so if I do get lazy (always) and do not shave my legs every few days, then I pretty much need reinforcements on my legs. On days that I would be lazy, this razor would be pointless because I would have to constantly rinse the shaver....which means that the lovely moisture bars would dwindle down to nothing within a few uses. I found that the moisture bars were not silky but rather sticky on my legs. Whenever I would rinse my leg, there was a residue from the shaver. After the shower, the shaver hook is useful but I do not like the fact that I NEED the hook in order to try a preserve the product. Hopefully you can tell from the photos that the bars turned into a deformed bar.<br /><br />Right after the shower, my legs did feel slightly raw and I did find a small nick (I cannot recall the last time I have cut my leg). Sitting here now, my legs do feel smooth but I had to add lotion to make sure my legs did not produce bumps.<br /><br />I had high hopes for this product but I definitely would stick to my original shaver. There are too many downsides to this product. The only saving grace would have been if the replacement cartridges were cheaper because I would definitely buy this for days when I just want to shave quickly. The \\"moisture\\" bars allows you to shave quickly but the amount of product you lose after each rinse is like money going down the drain.<br />Final Rating: 5/10bar.<br /><br />Right after the shower, my legs did feel slightly raw and I did find a small nick (I cannot recall the last time I have cut my leg).   20. The best razor I've used. I got the razor through a Gillette Venus program and was a little skeptical of being able to get around all the bumps and corners with such a big razor, but I don't think I've ever gotten such a close and smooth shave so quickly. The head of the razor is flexible enough and the moisturizing bars help glide the 5-blade razor over your skin so that you only have to go over a spot once. Although I don't know how quickly the moisturizing bar will last - I've used it three times now and it looks like it has reduced in size quite a bit. Several days after using it for the first time though my legs were still super smooth and it didn't look like I had missed any spots -- which was rare with my previous razors. I was done with shaving in record time and legs were so smooth I didn't even think of putting on lotion afterwards. Love this razor!!!

  77. Packaging:<br />A little bulky and unnecessary, the razor is small and it only came with one blade. It was quite hard to get into also, but honestly packaging doesn't really bother me because most people just throw it away as soon as they get the product so this wasn't much of a concern, just a minor annoyance.<br /><br />Physical Product:<br />What I really enjoyed about this razor was that it had 5 sharp blades and you could definitely tell you were getting a close shave and I definitely got a super close shave the first few uses!<br />I also liked that the handle wasn't too bulky or awkward to use. It didn't take up a bunch of room in your shower which was nice.<br />The in-shower storage holder was worthless. It literally fell three times and I finally just gave up on using it. The suction cup on the holder just didn't hold up at all. The awesome thing about it though was that the moisture bars didn't budge even though the razor kept falling! I was pretty surprised how sturdy they were and I wasn't expecting that.<br />The pivoting head on the razor was super flexible and made it easy to get every part of your leg.<br /><br />Travel:<br />If you travel quite a bit, there is honestly no good way of taking this razor with you. I went on a business trip and couldn't bring the razor because it has no protective covering for the blade head. I was too afraid the shave bars would fall off in my suitcase so unfortunately I had to leave it behind.<br /><br />More on the moisture bars:<br />The scent of the bars smelled amazing. When I first saw the name of the scent before smelling it I was a little worried it would be sickly sweet, but it was definitely a pleasant smell and thankfully the fragrance didn't irritate my legs.<br />As far as it having Olay(tm) moisturizer in the bars, I wasn't impressed. I have a problem with my legs getting super itchy after a shave if I don't use any moisturizer after (and sometimes that doesn't help). I was expecting this product to feel moisturizing and reduce the need for a ton of moisturizer slathered on my legs. Compared to other razors, it did a little better with not being so itchy, but it was honestly nothing amazing. I was quite disappointed by that.<br /><br />Use:<br />I have used competitor brands' razors that feature moisture bars so I knew what to expect and what to look for in a good razor with moisture bars. If you have never had the chance to try out a razor with built in shaving cream, they are a MUST HAVE! You reduce your shaving time in half and the GilletteÂ® Venus was no different. Since there were five blades, I got a seriously close shave the first few times of use.<br />Unfortunately, after a few uses the moisture bars started to wear quite a bit and the last time I used it, I had to go over my legs with another razor because the shave wasn't as good. GilletteÂ® claims that the razor blade head is supposed to last up to a month, key words \\"up to\\" because they definitely didn't last me a month! I have to shave every few days and found myself using other razors because the moisture bars wore so quickly.<br /><br />Another few things I don't really enjoy about the moisture bars is that they can only really be used for your legs and underarms. If you want to shave your bikini area for summer, good luck with that. I own four razors because I have ones with moisture bars and ones without for different areas.<br />BUT I think its completely worth having a razor with moisture bars because I definitely don't want to mess with shaving cream (an extra expense and waste of time) if I don't have to! With the moisture bars that step is taken away and like I said earlier, you LITERALLY reduce shaving time in half!<br /><br />Although the moisture bars can wear pretty quickly, its something to expect with this product. I think this product is good, nothing amazing and has room for improvement, but overall they made a good razor. The five blades and non-bulkiness really beat the competition,but there are some things that could be improved!<br /><br />Would I buy refill razors for this product and continue using it? Probably, but it has a lot of room for improvement. Its an awesome concept, but I think to beat its competitors it could improve a lot more! But then again, the competitors need a lot improvement too. Its definitely a good contender for a razor that features moisture bars though.<br /><br />I was sent the GilletteÂ® Venus and Olay(tm) razor via a program run by GilletteÂ® Venus for my HONEST review.but there are some things that could be improved!<br /><br />Would I buy refill razors for this product and continue using it? Probably, but it has a lot of room for improvement. Its an awesome concept, but I think to beat its competitors it could improve a lot more! But then again, the competitors need a lot improvement too. Its definitely a good contender for a razor that features moisture bars though.<br /><br />I was sent the GilletteÂ® Venus and Olay(tm) razor via a program run by GilletteÂ® Venus for my HONEST review.

  79. I received the Venus & Olay Razor in Sugarberry via a program run by Gillette Venus. After using this razor for two weeks, I have decided to give it four stars. The package that the razor came in included a razor handle, a cartridge, and a shower hook. The cartridge was very easy to snap onto the handle, and in addition, it had a lovely Sugarberry scent that added a nice touch to the razor! The shower hook was a perfect addition for me as well, as I am always just leaving my razor lying around somewhere in the bathroom - now I will know where my razor is at all times! This razor was very easy to use with its soft grip handle and its five blades. It provided a smooth, clean shave on my legs. However, I noticed that when I used the razor under my arms, it took a couple more tries to get a clean shave, possibly due to the bulky Olay Moisture Bars that are attached to the razor getting in the way. Other than that, I felt that this razor did its job quite nicely! As I stated, Olay Moisture Bars are attached to the cartridge itself to \\"help lock-in moisture to your skin for less dryness,\\" as Gillette claims on its packaging. The bars do indeed keep the skin moisturized, as even without the use of shaving cream, my skin felt quite soft still hours after shaving. My skin usually feels very dry and unpleasant if I do not use shaving cream, but this was not the case with the Venus & Olay Razor. However, I do not feel as if this aspect really impressed me enough to want to switch from my usual razor to this specific one. Furthermore, the Venus & Olay Razor and its replacement cartridges are quite expensive. Therefore, while I very much enjoyed using this razor, unless I find a great deal on the razor and cartridges in the future, I will probably stick with my current razor and shaving cream.

  108. I recently tried my Venus & Olay Razor for the first time; and while I usually can say nothing bad about either of these two companies, I have to honestly admit that my experience with this razor was disappointing. While the 5 blades of the razor worked wonderfully and left my legs and underarms with no stubble, the moisture bars alone made my experience less than pleasant.<br /><br />I used this razor for the first time in the shower; shaving my legs first, I had no problem, and the razor glided slickly and quickly on my legs. However, once the razor and moisture bars were exposed to more than a few drops of water from the shower, the bars became a sticky mess. I proceeded to attempt to shave my underarms, but it was nearly impossible.<br /><br /> Needless to say, both the razor and I didn't come out from the experience unscathed. I had to wash the sticky residue off of my arms, and the razor had hair bits semi-permanently attached to both moisture bars above and below the actual razor, and were even still stuck into the moisture bar after I had hung it outside of my shower with the given razor holder. Even when the razor was not exposed to water, the post-shower humidity made the bars begin to melt- and even froth a bit.<br /><br />This isn't a terrible razor- the razor itself is quite phenomenal and shaves without a problem. However, for somebody like myself who typically shaves in the shower, I do not highly advise this product. This razor would best be used post-shower- as I learned the hard way, too much water will turn the moisture pads into a gloppy mess. I am highly tempted to cut off both moisture bars from the razor, especially since there is a third, smaller moisture bar above the five blades already.<br /><br />Olay &Venus has made some great products in the past- needless to say, this is not one of them. I would personally suggest removing one of the moisture bars or making them smaller- however, as is, the razor is unusable where many women shave; in the shower.the shower.

I did not have a single snag, no nicks, and was able to shave my legs, underarms, and bikini area effortlessly. I tried this razor through a program run by Gillette Venus, and I am completely in love with it and will definitely be buying the refills. I don't ever use soap or shave cream because I'm too lazy, and consequently always suffer from nicks, ingrown hairs and severely dry legs. I'm so happy this razor addresses all of my issues. I've tried similar products in the past, but have found them to be too large and cumbersome. I was even able to shave my knees with no worry at all.
  123. I received this razor from a Gillette Venus program the other day and immediately opened it. the packaging by the way was much easier to open than many other brands I've used.The sugarberry scent is amazing, I love fruity smells and this one is no exception. I've never used a razor that had more than three or four blades and this one has five so I was curious as to whether or not the fifth blade would make a difference but boy was I wrong. I've never had a closer shave. one of my favorite things about this though is the moisturizing bars on the razor these asking with the five blades made my skin so unbelievably smooth and soft! no ugly red bumps, no irritation, just soft and smooth skin. My legs felt smooth and moisturized, even the knobby knee and ankle areas, which usually gets razor burns. It was also awesome how I didn't have to lather up beforehand, which saved me time in the shower. My only concern was how quickly the moisture bars seemed to dissolve in the water. When I was rinsing out the blades, I noticed that I was also inadvertently rinsing out the moisture bars, which I felt was a waste. Overall, I find it a great product, and I would certainly consider purchasing it after I use mine up.

  143. I am choosing one star to protest blatant deceit by this manufacturer. Shame on the company for intentionally misleading customers. One blade with five blade layers is not the same and the manufacturer knew it. Where did pride in product and honesty in advertising go? If your razor is good, you should not have to deceive to sell it.

I've never liked women's razors for a variety of reasons. Remember when they had big fat handles that were difficult to hold? At one time or another, I have tried all the latest and greatest women's razors, only to return to men's razors for their simplicity.<br /><br />First off, I can't believe the size of the moisture bars on the razor. Holy cow, it makes the razor head HUGE! This poses a huge problem: there is absolutely no effective and easy way to shave the problem areas of the legs like the ankle and knee caps. The moisture bars also make it harder to tell where the razor has already been because it shows a wider swath than what was actually shaved, meaning an uneven, stripey shave if you're not careful. I also thought the shave wasn't that close, as if the moisture bars were too elevated to let the razors actually touch the skin.<br /><br />Let's not forget the armpits. There was no way to shave the armpits with the large razor head. More like impossible.<br /><br />I call this an over-engineered piece of junk!

  190. I received the Gillette Venus & Olay razor free from Gillette for testing purposes. I am not picky about what I use to shave my legs - usually whatever disposables are on sale at the store, or sometimes my husband's razor. I usually just use some conditioner to shave with. I was interested in trying out this razor primarily because of the moisture bars, as it seemed like you could just use the razor without having to mess around with shaving creams or lotions.<br /><br />I tried this razor when I was leaving for a beach weekend as I wanted to be silky and smooth. The grips on the handle made it convenient to hold and not slippery, and the five blades made for a smooth enough shave. I didn't cut myself at all, which was great (a common issue with disposable razors). However, the large head of the razor (due to the moisture bars) made it really difficult to go around curves, leaving quite a few missed hairs around my ankles, knees, and armpits. Still, I was overall pretty satisfied with the smoothness of the shave.<br /><br />The real issue emerged shortly after I shaved. I was left with some serious razor burn and a large number of in-grown hairs, which almost never happens to me. It didn't make for smooth, beautiful skin, that's for sure. Next time, I wouldn't trust the moisture bars on their own and would definitely recommend using some kind of shaving cream or lotion (or even conditioner) if you're going to use it. That really cuts down on the convenience factor, unfortunately.

  227. I received a free razor through Bzz Agent. I normally use a standard razor and use soap for my 'shaving cream'.<br />First, I was surprised at how the blades were somewhat hidden among the Olay product and was unsure about it contacting my skin and shaving well. It did shave well, but I was kind of off-set by the goo trail it showed when I lifted the razor off the skin.<br /><br /> Also, I had to change my shower routine because of the Olay. I normally let my conditioner sit on my hair while I shave and then rinse off after I am done shaving. I noticed after 2 weeks my hair becoming brittle and having split ends. Since this is the only thing I have changed, I suspect the Venus/Olay razor. I changed the order I did things and my hair returned to normal.<br /><br />Finally, after 3 weeks of 3x a week use, I noticed that the razor no longer shaves well and I have to retrace paths a few times. For the price of the razor, this is a little faster than expected.<br /><br />In summary, If you are looking for a conditioning razor and don't want to hassle with shaving cream, this is a good razor. For me, I will go back to my 'el-cheapos' as they perform about the same and last as long.

I also noticed during the first shave, the Olay bars left gooey, slimy strands of Olay all over my legs as I was shaving. My second shave also had my legs covered in slime, but the Olay bars were starting to melt away, so it wasn't as bad. After the third shave, the bottom bar was completely dissolved, and the top bar was just barely holding on and the blades were already beginning to dull. After the Olay bars are completely dissolved, the tabs that held them on make the razor unusable anyway. Not what I expected for a really nice razor because the cheaper disposable razors I normally use last a LOT longer. Considering the cost of replacement heads and my experience, I don't believe this would be an item I would continue to use.

  248. Gillette has two varieties of the Venus & Olay razors: this Sugarberry scented one and [[ASIN:B0072K0SP8 Gillette Venus and Olay Razor]]. They both perform the same with the only difference being the scent. The Gillette Venus and Olay razor doesn't state it but it smells like warm vanilla, which I prefer over the Sugarberry scent. The Sugarberry scent is very faint and fades fast after initial use.<br /><br />This razor gives a close, smooth shave on the legs but does not work as well on the underarms because of the bulk of the shaving bar surrounding the razor. The plus side of the shaving bar's size is it keeps me from nicking myself in the underarm area. The shaving bar on the razor lathers up quickly initially but with each use it lathers less. The lather the first few uses is a little slimy.<br /><br />My legs are less than average hairy and I only shave from the knee down since I don't have any hair on the thighs so I was able to use this razor to shave my underarms every day and my legs about three times a week for 2 1/2 weeks before I felt like I needed to change the razor. I didn't need to use any soap (I don't use shaving creams) for the first week but by the second week I did use soap while shaving because by this point the shaving bar is 2/3 less it's original size and doesn't lather very well however the razor blades are still giving a smooth shave if not as moisturizing as the first week.<br /><br />The Venus & Olay razor does moisturize the legs and I never felt dry from shaving or razor burn which is a problem I have with most razors after shaving even the [[ASIN:B003EMPN7G Gillette Venus Original Razor, 1 Razor 2 Cartridges, 1-count Package]]. I'm switching the Venus & Olay razor from the Original Venus even though the refill razors cost more. I think the cost difference is worth not having razor burn or dry, tight skin after shaving.

  257. as much as I really enjoy using Gillette brand razors, I have always shied away from their products that included shave gel bars on the razor blade. I find they get gooey, do not tend to dry well and then you get a shorter life span of the razor. The Gillette Venus & Olay Sugarberry Scent Razor 1 Kit had a blade with the shave gel bar but I found the scent pleasing and the shave gel bar to work well if you are using this razor to shave your legs. It required me to press the blade down slightly harder on my leg in order to have the blade reach my skin, but once I adjusted my expectations, i found the razor did a great job of shaving my leg, with or without using additional shaving cream. I found it did not do as fantastic of a job on the underarm area.<br /><br />I would definitely use the product again, especially if traveling as I would not need to bring shaving cream. The other major negative is that the kit only comes with one blade, thus requiring you to purchase several additional blades. all in all, I would go out and purchase extra blade to use.

I usually have problems with my razors slipping all over the place when I try to shave my legs, but this was really easy to keep a hold of and control.<br /><br />So, if you have problems with sensitive, dry, easily irritated legs, don't be afraid to buy this razor. I definitely don't see myself going back to any other razor.<br /><br />There is one con about this that I really did not like at all, though - and that was the scent. The scent is really too strong for my liking. I took one whiff of this and it was a really strong . It doesn't smell too bad after using it and it does die down, but it's the initial shock of the smell at first. I would have preferred it be a softer smell, but it is easy to get used to.<br /><br />So, if you don't like heavily scented products such as the smell of Sugarberry, don't let it stop you from getting this - as the smell does die down after the first use or two.<br /><br />Overall, I really, really love this razor. I was surprised with how great this is.<br />Go give it a try!y to get used to.<br /><br />So, if you don't like heavily scented products such as the smell of Sugarberry, don't let it stop you from getting this - as the smell does die down after the first use or two.<br /><br />Overall, I really, really love this razor.   274. I've been a fan of the Venus brand razors for a while now, so I was excited with having the privilege to try out their new Venus & Olay in Sugarberry via a program by Gillette. The packaging itself is nice to look at with various sparkles and bright color. I was impressed with how easy to open and access the contents was--just pull back the top and the razor slides right out. Immediately I noticed the smell and thought it was lovely. The razor itself looks similar to the other Venus razors but white and pink. The handle has a very rubbery feel to it which allows for better gripping which is very handy if you're trying to shave odd angles. The major thing that separated this razor from the rest is the bulky moisturizing bars adjacent to the blades. They're massive! At first I thought it would be a problem to shave with, but it wasn't so bad... One interesting tidbit that I read about was that this razor did not need shaving cream. I decided to try this out and was pleasantly surprised that it worked! When the moisturizing bars get wet they start getting very sticky which provides enough lubrication for a gentle shave. I was honestly impressed by this and didn't need to use shaving cream at all. It was great while shaving my legs; however, when I tried my underarms, I had difficulty maneuvering the razor because of how bulky it was. It was almost impossible to get some hairs. Also, it isn't exactly moisturizing. I noticed it did moisturize a little bit, but I still needed lotion after my shower. The bars also do not seem to last that long, unfortunately. Which is not so bad since you can still use the razor, you just have to use shaving cream. Overall, I recommend this razor. It does not require shaving cream (until the moisturizing bar runs out), it doesn't moisturize as well as it advertises, and the bulky bars could hinder other areas of your body to be shaven, but it really is a great, simple razor when it comes down to it.

  305. I've used Venus razors before, first the \\"original\\" kind and then the breeze model. I've been pretty satisfied with the breeze and been using it for a while now so when I was contacted through a Gillette-run program to try this product, I was more than happy to use it.<br /><br />This razor is definitely as advertised. Once it got wet, it was slick enough to use without any soap or shaving creme at all which was nice and convenient.<br /><br />The blades were really nice- it only took one swipe to get rid of hair. I've always had sensitive skin on the bikini zone and underarm area, to the point in getting nicks while shaving and getting red bumps the day after even when using a shaving gel specifically for sensitive skin. I noticed that even without any shaving cream/soap that I didn't have the inflamed skin the day after like I usually did.<br /><br />However, as nice as the blade was, the moisturizing strips are a little fragile- at least the one on the top. After two shaves using the razor, the top moisturizing strip had lost about a third of the starting amount, and was starting to come off the pieces where it was attached. The bottom moisturizing strip was still in good shape though. I don't know if this is because I press down too much, I do press down my index finger on the blade when I shave so that could factor in. Regardless, the fragility might mean that I have to replace the razor head before the blades even get dull.<br /><br />Over all, the pros of not getting inflamed skin and the much quicker time it took to shave were big pluses that outweigh the con of perhaps having to replace the head earlier than I would like. I would definitely recommend this product.

I didn't quite notice an overbearing smell at all. It was nice and pleasant. The moisture bars offered a nice lather for my shave and I experience no tugging or nicks. The moisture effects are just as described and last for days. It is great not to have to use shaving cream or soap. It cuts one step out of my routine, and there is no price on time. I have used this razor 3 times and have not noticed a huge difference in the size of the moisture bars and it seems like they will last a very long time. The swivel head on the razor was a very nice touch as it moved and conformed to my body's curves. I also very much appreciate wall hanger suction was an excellent addition and it works perfectly.
  307. I will be buying these razors from now on. I really like that in a pinch I don't need any shaving cream. The lotion around the razor moisturizes enough that the razor glides smoothly and easily over the skin. The blades are sharp and cut close to the skin without irritating my skin. The shave lasted a few days and I was overall really happy with the razor. The scent is feminine and fun without being overpowering. I have used it 5 times and it is still going strong. Well worth the money.
  308. As far as razors go, this is a good one! I was surprised to find that the scent was really nice when I opened up the package. I guess this razor works better on people with soft light hair not thick. But besides that is a great razor and leaves your skin smooth, of course more smooth if you have light hair lol.

  371. The new Venus & Olay Razor arrived in my mailbox a few weeks ago in a nondescript yellow envelope that belied the gloriously holographic packaging inside, courtesy of Gillette Venus. The first thing I noticed was the great scent (\\"Sugarberry\\") - light and sweet, but not overwhelmingly sugar. I also liked that it wasn't one of those thick, heavy scents - I hate when I use a new shaving cream and end up broadcasting the fact that I'd shaved with a preceding cloud of scent.<br /><br />Olfactorily satisfied, I hung up the razor in its little suction cup-ed holder in my shower (taking immense satisfaction in its ability to actually hold the razor without losing its grip on the tiled shower wall) to await shaving time later. By the time shower time rolled around I was beyond excited to try out my new razor...even though I only had about 0.25 centimeters of growth (an extremely generous estimate). Truthfully I had shaved only two days before, so I knew that if I shaved again it would be less \\"shaving\\" and more \\"spot treating.\\" Alas, the clarion call of the Venus & Olay razor was too difficult to resist, so spot treating be damned! - I went ahead and started shaving. I was immediately impressed by how the water from the shower transformed the solid shaving cream attached to the razor into an almost slimy, intensely moisturizing, shaving gel. The razor glided over my skin, leaving no cuts or nicks on my bare skin while effectively and brutally eliminating all the 'lone rangers.' The remaining shave gel rinsed off naturally over the course of the shower without any extra rinsing or toweling, and also wasn't excessively foamy, which I liked. The last time I tried one those thicker, super foamy (and so I thought, extra moisturizing) shave creams, I had to hose down the tub after every shave - a particularly galling annoyance when you're already running late for work. It was almost like shaving with moisturizing serum, which I will admit I have done in a pinch. I particularly liked how instead of surrounding the entire razor with the solid shave cream, the Venus & Olay razor has two strips of the shave cream on the top and bottom of the razor blades, which are attached to a head that has some freedom of movement so it glides over the contours of your legs (or armpits, or whatever) for a close shave that doesn't require doing yoga poses in the shower.<br /><br />A few days later, when the stubble had well and truly started growing, I gave the Venus & Olay razor its second run - and like the first time around, it met all my expectations. I will say that there were a few spots where it missed a few hairs (mainly on the backs of my calves) but that's probably due more to my laziness/traditionally kind of laissez-faire attitude towards that area (who really looks at the backs of calves, anyway?!) than any real defect on the razor's part. And just like last time, my legs stayed well moisturized after the shower - so much so that I didn't even bother putting on lotion, an added bonus that shaved a full five minutes off my post-shower ritual. Win.<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this razor to everyone - it's one of those one-stop-shopping items that will not only make your life easier but simultaneously free up quite a bit of cupboard space as you stop buying shaving cream, lotion, other razors...AND, you can even store the thing on your shower wall. No more razors lying around listlessly on the edge of the tub for this apartment!ked how instead of surrounding the entire razor with the solid shave cream, the Venus & Olay razor has two strips of the shave cream on the top and bottom of the razor blades, which are attached to a head that has some freedom of movement so it glides over the contours of your legs (or armpits, or whatever) for a close shave that doesn't require doing yoga poses in the shower.<br /><br />A few days later, when the stubble had well and truly started growing, I gave the Venus & Olay razor its second run - and like the first time around, it met all my expectations. I will say that there were a few spots where it missed a few hairs (mainly on the backs of my calves) but that's probably due more to my laziness/traditionally kind of laissez-faire attitude towards that area (who really looks at the backs of calves, anyway?!) than any real defect on the razor's part. And just like last time, my legs stayed well moisturized after the shower - so much so that I didn't even bother putting on lotion, an added bonus that shaved a full five minutes off my post-shower ritual. Win.<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this razor to everyone - it's one of those one-stop-shopping items that will not only make your life easier but simultaneously free up quite a bit of cupboard space as you stop buying shaving cream, lotion, other razors...AND, you can even store the thing on your shower wall. No more razors lying around listlessly on the edge of the tub for this apartment!

Clearly the size cannot be helped but I didn't feel like it handled very well in um.. \\"tight corners.\\" I was impressed with the five blades, the exfoliating factor, and the close shave I got on my legs and under arms.   375. I had a coupon for this item, so I figured, why not?<br /><br />The scent is really nice if you like something a little more springy and sweet, which I do. The handle for the razor is probably the most comfortable one I've ever tried, and I've tried A LOT of razors on the market, mostly because I had very sensitive skin. I either get razor burn easily, nick terribly, my skin dries out, etc... After seeing rave reviews for this, I was eager to try it.<br /><br />However, I won't use it again. I didn't get a close shave at all; my legs are still fuzzy and I can already feel a dry/burning feeling on my skin, despite it being less than five minutes since I finished shaving. The soap bars hardly lathered up for me, and even when it seemed like they were, the actual razor was still painful in spots. I didn't notice much of an exfoliating feeling, so I was a little disappointed there, because that seemed unique. Besides the scent and comfortable handle, it's hard to say good things. The actual razors aren't anything special, and I get a closer shave from my usual razor. The suction cup holder probably only works on tiled bathroom walls, which I do not have, so that part is useless to me.<br /><br />If you have sensitive skin, be wary. I have to go re-shave my legs because this one did such a poor job. I had high hopes for this, but like others have said, it's nothing special and has lots of room for improvement.

  380. I received Gillette Venus & Olay Razor free from a program run by Gillette and I absolutely love how the Venus & Olay Razor is packaged; it's so easy to open with a semi detached seam at the back of the packaging. The previous packaging for Venus razors had to be open with some sort of sharp object which was kind of a hassle. I really do not see any difference from the Venus Spa Breeze. Both styles have some sort of moisturizing gel above and below the blades that eliminates the need for shaving cream. The lotion strip is a nice touch and des leave legs feeling smooth and soft but when the razor is left in the shower on the awesome shower hook included in the packaging, after a while the lotion strip starts getting all gooey. I assume from the steam of the shower then the texture of the lotion strip isn't very pleasant as the first use. That is probably my only complaint for the Venus & Olay(tm) Razor. On the bright side, the razor is great for vacation or traveling that way there is no need to pack shaving cream. I prefer to use the Venus & Olay(tm) Razor for travel and the Venus Embrace for every day use.

  389. I recently was provided the Venus & Olay Razor in Sugarberry from a program run by Gillette Venus. Admittedly, I was a bit skeptical at first. But can you blame me? Razors promise a bunch of things, but somehow never seem to deliver on EVERYTHING, but I'd say that the Venus & Olay Razor follows through. First off, let's talk about the handle. Oftentimes other razors will place (namely where your finger will rest) and that's it. For me, this tends to result in a slippery accident and plenty of nicks. The Venus & Olay handle is 100 percent COVERED in soft rubber and has a perfectly placed notch to put your finger. I was able to firmly grip the handle and didn't have any worries about it slipping from my hands. Onto the head and actual razor. The razor head contains 5 blades and Olay Moisture Bars on each side of the blades. It smells fantastic-fruity, but clean. One thing the bothers me about razors is that they tell you the the head pivots to make shaving easier, and yet the thing barely moves. I happen to have difficulty shaving my knees and often cut myself because the head does not move the way I need it to. The Venus & Olay razor, however, has an extremely flexible head, allowing me to shave my knees without fear of nicks. Now, each of these promises to do something special for you. The 5 blade technology is supposed to provide a close shave and is meant to exfoliate your skin, while the Olay Moisture Bars act as your shaving cream as well as a long lasting moisturizer.This is a definite must for me, because that means I don't have to buy messy shaving cream that will get everywhere and wash off before I can actually shave! When I'm buying a new razor, I always look for 5 blades. The more thinner and finer blades, the closer and longer lasting the shave-well, at least that's what I've learned in my own experience, so the fact the this razor has 5 blades that promise to exfoliate your skin too? It's great! I was worried that the Moisture Bars would prevent me from getting close to my skin to ensure a really smooth shave, and was surprised when they didn't. My legs were smooth, and a part from a few stubbly patches, the razor gave me a very close shave, and my legs are still smooth, despite using it 3 days ago and there were absolutely no nicks! The collaboration between Gillette Venus and Olay is pure brilliance. For the summer time, I'm looking for silky smooth legs, and this alliance gives me just what I need.m getting close to my skin to ensure a really smooth shave, and was surprised when they didn't. My legs were smooth, and a part from a few stubbly patches, the razor gave me a very close shave, and my legs are still smooth, despite using it 3 days ago and there were absolutely no nicks!   407. I received my Venus & Olay Razor in Sugarberry from a program being run by Gillette Venus.<br /><br />Having heard so many great things about Venus razors I was eager to try them myself. Built-in shaving gel could only be a plus! Right?<br /><br />IN SHORT:<br />The razor shaves close and well. I like! The moisture bars are bulky and annoying around my bikini line, but they work great as a shaving gel and as a moisturizer. Overall it's just an OK razor.<br /><br />Want all the dirty details?<br /><br />PROS:<br />-It shaves close and smooth. What more can you ask for from a razor?<br />-Built-in shaving gel does a great job with coverage so there really is no need for more soap or cream. The gel pad at the bottom makes sure to distribute a liberal amount before the razor blades follow.<br />-The Olay Moisture Bars actually did help a LOT with my abysmally dry and flaky legs.<br />-As one with beyond sensitive skin I 100% expected this razor to make me burn and itch. It didn't. Pleasant surprise!<br />-The handle is the standard Venus one, so any of their other cartridges will work with it.<br /><br />CONS:<br />-BULK. This razor head is giant which makes getting into close quarters (underarms, bikini line) a major hassle.<br />-You have to use some pressure to get the actual blades to touch your skin due to the clunky moisture bars. This creates some serious concern for cuts because...<br />-The Olay Moisture Bars, while very effective, are also extremely slimy. Apply pressure on a slippery surface with sharp blades and see what will inevitably happen :(<br />-I fear those Moisture Bars won't last very long. Rinsing out the hair from the blades exposes these bars to a lot more water than I believe they were designed for.<br />-Minor con: The suction cup for the razor's hook does not work on my shower tiles, nor on the window.

  414. I was very excited when I was offered to try this for free from a program run by Gillette Venus. I have always suffered from dry skin, so much that I generally avoid shaving my legs in the winter and have to hardcore moisturize them in the summer when I do. We also see shaving cream as an unnecessary product in my house, so I usually have to resort to soap or conditioner.<br />The Good: This razor does an excellent job of shaving. The blades are very tiny and very sharp and they gave me a very close shave. I still have a few stubbles and hairs that it missed (not to mention any ingrown hairs) but for the most part it did a great job of getting as close as possible- something that I find a rarity in women's razors.<br />The moisture bars are extremely moisturizing and do a fantastic job of providing just enough slick to shave but not so much that it clogs the razor.<br />The scent is very pleasant. It's a nice calming smell but not overbearing. They do have an unscented one for those people that are allergic to perfumes and scents too!<br />Although I don't use the shower hook, it does come with one.<br />The Bad: Although this razor does an excellent job of moisturizing, it almost seems as if the moisture comes off a little bit TOO easy and it seems if some of the moisture bar is wasted. After four uses, my moisture bars were flat with the razor and had a lot of residue. It also tended to make the armpit area a little stickier (easily removed with soap). The last thing is the cost. It's definitely up there in the pricier razor range, which, if you're using it in the summer you're going to be using it often and have to replace your blades more often to get the maximum efficiency from the moisture bars.<br />All in all, I probably will not purchase replacement heads for the summer, but definitely will buy when winter comes.
  415. The venus and gillette razor is a convenient razor that provides a luxurious shaving experience. I was provided the razor in the scent \\"sugarberry\\" by a program run by Gillette Venus. The scent is a little on the sweeter side and may not suit everyone's taste. I found it to be quite a nice scent that stays on your legs after shaving. While using this razor, I didn't accidentally cut myself, which is a bonus for me! The moisture bars lubricate your legs as you shave and creates a nice foamy lather, similar to that of a shaving cream.<br />Although the moisture bars were very creamy, they did not make my legs feel any smoother than if I had shaves with any other razor. Another downside of this razor would be the lasting power of the moisture bars. The moisture bars only lasted about 4-5 times for me. If you shave every day or every other day like I do, this wold mean having to replace cartridges every week or every other week. This would be extremely costly.<br />Overall, this is a great razor for those who don't mind spending the extra money.

My legs were so smooth I actually ran out of the bathroom as soon as I was done showering to make my boyfriend feel them. I definitely needed to use shaving cream, and go over parts of my legs multiple times, which made it feel like I was using just another razor.   419. I received this Venus & Olay razor from a program run by Gillette Venus, and I was pretty happy with it's results.<br /><br />When I first began using the razor, I found myself happy that I didn't have to use messy shaving cream along with my razor since it had two pads of sweet-smelling, creamy gel around the top and bottom to act as a lubricant during the shaving process. The razor worked wonderfully on my underarms, as it just took one or two swoops with the pink razor until they were really soft, leaving practically zero bumps or rips in my skin. I was happy! However, the razor quickly dropped the ball when it came to the challenge of leg-shaving.<br /><br />After shaving my underarms, I was excited to shave my not-so-smooth legs, anticipating that they would be a cinch as well. However, much to my dismay, the razor proved to be a little on the incompetent side when it came to shaving legs. I found that I had to keep going over the same spots over and over to get the same smoothness as my underarms. I also felt that the gel pads seemed to be dissolving in the stream of the shower water much too quickly, as I was spending a longer time trying to get a clean shave on my legs. After I tried shaving my legs with this Sugarberry razor, I was disappointed that the gel had almost completely disappeared, and since I wanted to use the razor the next time I was in the shower (for my underarms, most likely) I decided to put the Sugarberry razor down and pick up a different razor- one with out the lubricating gel strips- to finish the job of shaving my legs. I have to note that my legs weren't resembling a werewolf's when I was shaving with the Sugarberry razor, so I was surprised when it didn't seem to shave them well enough. I didn't think they would be much of a challenge for this razor, but they seemed to be.<br /><br />Maybe a suggestion would be to make the blades sharper, or make the gel pads almost less-gelly so that they didn't dissolve so quickly in the water? I'm not sure, I don't have a degree in razor-developing, but if the kink is worked out, I would love to buy this razor again. As I said in the beginning, it was really awesome all around: the smell, the style, the effectiveness on tackling underarm hair, the smooth and silky skin it left behind, etc. However, it just wasn't up to par on shaving legs. I feel like having smooth legs is a goal for many women who purchase Venus razors, thus I feel like this is an issue that should be solved quickly.<br /><br />I enjoyed using this razor though, and if you only need a razor for soft and delicate shaving, this one's for you! But if you have a mess of stubborn leg hair, then maybe not...not sure, I don't have a degree in razor-developing, but if the kink is worked out, I would love to buy this razor again. As I said in the beginning, it was really awesome all around: the smell, the style, the effectiveness on tackling underarm hair, the smooth and silky skin it left behind, etc. However, it just wasn't up to par on shaving legs. I feel like having smooth legs is a goal for many women who purchase Venus razors, thus I feel like this is an issue that should be solved quickly.<br /><br />I enjoyed using this razor though, and if you only need a razor for soft and delicate shaving, this one's for you! But if you have a mess of stubborn leg hair, then maybe not...

  545. Unboxing: The Gillette Venus & Olay Razor came in three parts: 1. The razor attachment, 2. the handle, and 3. a little holder to suction on a bathtub tile wall or mirror. The package was fairly easy to open and didn't have me fighting plastic. I was greeted by the pleasant strawberry scent of the razor, which is individually packaged. The handle tip locks into the razor and is light weight and easy to control.<br />During use: After the moisture bars are wet, the \\"gel\\" makes shaving a breeze due to the fact that I didn't have to lather up with shaving cream. The strawberry scent is also very nice. I was a little worried of razor burn or accidentally cutting myself if I didn't get it wet enough, but once the gel bars were wet, it was lathered enough to easily move to the curves of the legs and give a VERY close shave.<br /><br />After use: I have used the razor for a little over a week now. Since using it, I have shaved once every 2 days. Sometimes I can stretch it to 3. The razor has given me the closest shave I've ever had!<br /><br />Overall review: I would give this 4.5 stars out of 5. Overall, I LOVE this razor. It makes shaving quick and easy. I am a big fan of \\"2-in-1\\" and this definitely fits the bill. It is very moisturizing and my shave lasts a few days. The only thing I did not like was that after a few strokes, the gel would create a \\"lather\\" and the texture was similar to slobber when I pulled it away from my legs. Not nice to look at and strange to get use to the consistency, but I can get past it because it gives me super smooth legs!<br /><br />How long will it last? I predict that the cartridge will last maybe about a month with frequent use. After my week of shaving, there has been a noticeable difference in how much gel is left. I also noticed that the gel is on the front and the back of the razor. I am not sure what will happen once I use up all the gel in the front. Maybe I'll carefully rub the back on my legs to lather?<br /><br />(This was sent to me by Gillette Venus. I was not paid to review this product. This review is 100% my honest opinion.)to me by Gillette Venus. I was not paid to review this product. This review is 100% my honest opinion.)

  579. As a mom of a toddler who takes showers during short naps or on rare occasions where I have help in the day, I don't get the &#34;luxurious&#34; shower experience often. I seized the opportunity to try the new Venus & Olay Razor in Sugarberry when I was given the chance to try it through a program run by Gillette Venus.<br /><br />I'm rating this razor three stars because even though it gave me some nasty razor burn on my legs, someone without sensitive skin may not share this experience. It also works better than any other razor I've tried for underarms, and the Olay soap is silky enough that my underarm skin actually feels noticeably softer after shaving.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Five blades is not a marketing ploy - this is truly one very close shave!<br />-Works off the same handle as all other Venus razors, so you don't need to buy a new razor to try the blade<br />-Shaving was quick and easy - perfect for those on a time crunch.<br />-Even with the Olay bars, the razor is sleek and natural to grip - no bulk. It contours to the natural curves of your legs without nicks on ankles or knees.<br />-Soap smells great, is silky, and goes well onto skin without need for extra lathering.<br />-Soap bars last a long time and dry out well between showers, so you don't lose your soap while you're not using it to shave.<br /><br />Cons:<br />-If you have sensitive skin, be prepared for the razor burn of a lifetime if you don't add shaving cream or another lubricant. Even with extra soap, I still got razor burn on my calfs and the less fleshy parts of my legs. I have no issues with other five bladed razors, so I have to assume it's that delightful Sugarberry that's irritating the skin.<br />-The blades themselves dull pretty quickly, and replacement blades are pricy.<br /><br />I won't continue using this razor for my legs until Gillette comes out with a Sensitive Skin version (please, Gillette?), but I will keep it simply because it is so fabulous for my underarms.   585. I've used and loved the original Venus razors for years, so when Gilette offered me the opportunity to test out a new type of Venus razor, I was both curious and skeptical. I didn't really think anything could be better than the original, especially a scented razor (I have sensitive skin)--but as it turns out, the Sugarberry scent is delightful and non-irritating, and this razor does in fact improve on the original.<br /><br />Those moisturizing shave bars do more than just eliminate the need for shaving cream (which is super-convenient on its own, let me tell ya!). They also leave my legs super smooth and sleek, and not dry at all. If you have dry skin then you know shaving can be a drag (literally), but this razor made smooth work of even delicate spots like my knees, ankles and bikini line. I never felt dry and I felt like the risk of nicks really went down. Further--this razor gave me such a smooth shave, I was able to go an extra day between shaves. Total win, especially now that summer is here and I'm extra-busy. I don't need to waste extra time in the shower when I could be hitting the beach!<br /><br />My one complaint is that the razor doesn't contain the most natural of ingredients. So, if you're trying to find natural products, you'd be better off purchasing a separate shaving cream with a standard razor. It just depends on how natural you want to go; I usually don't worry that much about shaving creams since they don't stay on the skin. I should also note that this razor may not be cruelty-free, since Gilette does do some animal testing.

I don't shave every time I'm in the shower but when I compared the level of smoothness I got between the Venus razor and a generic triple-blade razor, I couldn't see a difference in the results, making me less likely to pay much more for a five-blade razor. The moisturizing bars were nice to prevent nicks in the shower, but I still felt the need to put lotion on my legs afterward. I felt that my legs were not sufficiently moisturized from the Olay moisture bars.<br /><br />Overall, I give the product 4/5 stars. It provided a really nice shave but for me I think the price point is too high when I can use a generic for similar results.

  624. I received the Venus & Olay Razor as a part of a program run by Gillette Venus. After using the shaver for several days, my overall opinion is that the Venus & Olay Razor packs a typical razor with the moisturizing power of Olay, and while that's nice, it's not groundbreaking.<br /><br />Upon first taking my razor out of the package, I found clipping in the cartridge was an easy process and the berry scent was pleasant. I later noticed that the berry scent must be in the handle, because the Olay moisturizer did not smell berry-like and the scent never transferred to my skin (I wish it would've).<br /><br />I used the suction cup holder to keep the razor in my shower, and not even five minutes after I was in the shower, the suction cup lost its suction, the razor fell, and the cartridge popped out of the handle. I spent ten minutes trying to maneuver the cartridge back onto the shaver handle, worried each moment that I was going to cut myself and trying to make it work with the slipper Olay moisturizer.<br /><br />The shaver shaves well, but I find the Olay moisturizer portions to make shaving your underarms difficult. The milky white portion of the Olay moisturizer was sometimes goopy when I ran it up my legs, and it created an almost mucusy portion of moisturizer as I pulled the razor from my skin. If the niche of this razor is to have the Olay moisturization, I wish they would've supplied something that could cover the parts of the cartridge. I don't think the Olay portion will last very long.<br /><br />Afterward, my legs did feel hair-free and soft, and I'm now on day seven without having to shave again. There is no noticeable hair.<br /><br />Overall, I'll continue using my Venus & Olay Razor, but I think there needs to be a few things changed to make this razor better. If the only thing differentiating it from a regular Venus razor is the Olay part, I would save myself a few dollars and just purchase a regular Venus razor.

  629. I have always been skeptical of razors that include moisturizer or gel strips because I have dry skin and it never seemed like those little strips could do the job to make my legs smooth and moisturized. When I got the opportunity to try the Venus & Olay razor through a program run by Gillette Venus, I was excited to finally put it to the test. I use Olay face products so I was really trusting that Olay would provide great moisture for my shave. After using the razor, I am glad that Gillette teamed up with Olay because my legs are not dry at all - after a few showers, I even noticed I was using less lotion!<br /><br />Shaving with the Venus & Olay razor completely changed my routine. I live in a small apartment with only a tiny shower stall rather than a tub, so usually I have to get out of the shower, lather my legs, and shave using a water basin and traditional razor. With this razor I can shave in the shower without worrying about the water washing away my shave gel (big $ waster!) or having to get out of the shower to shave my legs, then back in to rinse off (big time waster!).<br /><br />The Olay moisturizing strips are really smooth which makes shaving a breeze. They retract a little when I press the razor to my legs, so the blades get really close and move easily across my moisturized skin. Since I bend over completely (tiny shower stall, remember?) to shave, this helps me finish shaving faster so I don't have to spend 15 minutes bent over, going over the same spots to make sure they were shaved. As an added bonus, the scent of the moisturizer is very light but smells great.<br /><br />I have one tiny complaint - rinsing off the razor between strokes seems like it uses up a little of the moisturizing strips due to the water hitting it (sort of like using a bar of soap). This could cause me to run out of the moisturizer a little quicker and have to purchase more cartridges. Even so, I won't need to buy shave gel anymore, so that evens it out, plus I just love the easy breezy, effective shave I get!<br /><br />Thanks Gillette & Olay for a great product!ve the easy breezy, effective shave I get!<br /><br />Thanks Gillette & Olay for a great product!

  643. Do I really need a scented razor? No, not really. Still, I've found this to be a good and useful razor, one that has benefits beyond the scent (which seems to be promoted as the main selling point). Basically, this is a razor that works without the need for shaving gel or similar. All it requires is water. The head of the razor is buffered by two large moisture strips, which activate when wet. With just water I found that this razor glided easily over my legs and underarms. I could definitely smell the sugarberry scent when I opened the package- it's sort of a generic berry, bath product scent. When I got the razor in the shower, however, I didn't really notice the scent- that might be because the scent tones down in the water, or it could be because I'd already used scented shampoo and soap, so my nose was otherwise occupied. In any case, the scent is not very strong. There are only a couple of drawbacks to this product that I don't find to be very major issues. First, the moisture from the razor can be a bit gooey. It does the job, but the feeling is a little gross. I prefer the feeling of shave gel, but the convenience of this razor outweighs the texture issues. The other issue is that without a foamy gel coating my legs, it's more difficult to see what parts I've shaved and what parts I haven't, so it's a bit easier to miss spots. That is a bit of an issue, but the fact that this razor is SO easy to use means that I can just go over those areas next time I'm in the shower. Overall, I LOVE the convenience of being able to shave with just a razor and water.

So for me it isn't really worth the price.

  671. I received this razor from a program run by Gillette Venus to try out. I've been using this razor for about a week now and I can definitely tell that my legs feel smoother after a shave. With the Venus + Olay razor, there is no need for shaving cream. Just run the moisture bar under the water for a second and then you can start shaving. The moisture bars make for a very smooth and close shave, and I have yet to cut myself at all, even around my ankles! I know I've used a razor in the past that had a moisture bar and it left a strange film on my legs, but this one doesn't at all. My legs feel silky and smooth, almost as though I applied lotion to them. The moisture bar seems like it will last a while...I've used it probably five times already and have yet to notice any real wear to it. You should always hang it on the shower hook so it dries properly. If you lay it on the side of the tub or something, the moisture part of it tends to stick to ceramic.<br /><br />I'd definitely recommend this product and will probably buy a new set of cartridges once this one is used up. It's just so much easier to use this than to have to lather up in shaving cream and then shave. Plus, my legs feel smoother with this than my old razor anyway!

  673. I was provided this Venus & Olay(tm) Razor in Sugarberry via a program run by Gillette Venus, and I was so excited to try it out! The packaging was attractive, with the razor blade packaged in a smaller container inside the bigger package with the razor handle and the shower holder. I was glad that Gillette Venus included this shower holder in the package, since I usually toss my razors back into my shower caddy or onto the edge of my bathtub to dry, so the holder is definitely a plus for me.<br /><br />First impressions of the razor:<br />I read other reviews that stated the Sugarberry scent was too sickeningly sweet for them even while opening the package, but I only caught a whiff of the scent while opening the package. The scent isn't an important factor for me when using a razor, since I'm in the shower anyway, but the sugarberry scent was light and refreshing, almost like a shampoo.<br /><br />The two lotion bars above and below the blades flex forward and back when being used, which gives you the ability to go around curves and hard to reach places. I wet my legs and the razor to activate the lotion bars and the blades glided very smoothly over my skin without any tugging. I was able to go behind and over my knees without any problems, thanks to the pivoting head of the blades and the flexible lotion bars. What I realized was that I couldn't rinse the blades like how I usually do after every few strokes to get rid of the hairs in the blades, since this would cause the lotion bars to melt and would go to waste. What I did was to slightly rinse the razor from behind the blades to get rid of excess hair, which helped slightly.<br /><br />Overall impression:<br /><br />Great razor with great moisturizing abilities. The blades glided over my skin smoothly and the lotion bars provided my skin with protection from nicks and cuts. The shower holder is a plus, along with the soft handle which provides easy grip. The scent is a nice addition, but isn't a huge factor for me since I would be rinsing my legs off anyway. My only gripe for this product is about the rinsing of the blades due to the lotion bars--ironically, while the lotion bars are the best features of the razor, it deters me from rinsing the blades too much as the bars will melt away. But overall, this is one of the best razors that moisturizes your skin while you shave!r me since I would be rinsing my legs off anyway. My only gripe for this product is about the rinsing of the blades due to the lotion bars--ironically, while the lotion bars are the best features of the razor, it deters me from rinsing the blades too much as the bars will melt away. But overall, this is one of the best razors that moisturizes your skin while you shave!

Overall this did cut down on the time of shaving but the drawbacks out weigh the good things about the razor. I don't think I will be switching razors any time soon.
  681. I got this razor as a part of a Gilette campaign. I was skeptical at first because I have used razors with built in shaving cream before, and they did not provide enough lubricant to shave without upsetting my sensitive skin.<br />I have been using this razor for about a week, and the moisture bars are holding up very well. It moisturizes my skin very well and gives me a close shave without irritation. I like being able to just pick up a razor and shave without having to lather up shaving cream. I will be buying this product again.
  682. I absolutely love this razor! The cream on either side of the FIVE blades keeps your skin both moisturized and smooth. As always, the Venus has the closest shave I've experienced, with five blades and no irritation whatsoever! Also, I am guilty of not always grabbing for shaving cream, enter this razor!! No need for shaving cream!! Overall I love it and will be repurchasing!!
  683. Great razor. Smells so good. I love how soft and silky smooth my legs are. My mom loved it too!
  684. I received this free product from Gillette to test it out, I was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked. The Olay Moisture Bars completely eliminate the need for soap or shaving cream. This makes it great for a quick razor-burn-less shave. The only down I have with the concept is the soap bar drying a bit between shaves.
  685. I received this razor as a free sample through a program by Gillette Venus. Previous to receiving this sample, I would not have purchased this item, but it is well worth it. This razor makes shaving quick and easy! No shaving cream required? WHAT? Yes, this is my favorite part about this razor, as well as the pleasing fragrance of the olay bar, and the neat shower hanger. I would definitely recommend this product!!
  686. I very greatly enjoy using this Gilette Venus&Olay razor. The package is very bright and eye catching. The scent is Sugar Berry, it is very sweet, summer smell. That had me interested in the product before I had even tried it yet. Once I did I liked it even more. The soft Olay Moisturizing strips keep your legs silky soft and very moist. The 5 blade razor cuts extremely close to the skin Sioux leaving a single nic, scratch or bump. Unfortunately with many other razors I have experienced razor burn, but luckily not with this product. I couldn't be happier with the outcome of having shiny, silky soft summer legs to show off at the pool, beach and around town! This is a must buy. You will be extremely satisfied! I guarantee you that!
  687. If your reading this; thinking about trying it...BUY IT!! You can probably get it cheaper if you print out an online coupon or get a $3-$5 off coupon in the newspaper and look for sales. It's deft a great smooth have; no left per hairs after one swipe; no kicks or cuts and glides smooth around curved areas. (Underarms,knees) do not keep in shower or keep wetting the razor the Olay moisturizer will rare off very quickly and then you have to use having cream but not a problem; razor lasts a long time :)
